description.narrative:
The programme focuses on reducing CO2 emissions by developing long-term energy planning through annual Ukraine Energy Outlooks and on strengthening Ukraine's energy efficiency and district heating by utilizing surplus heat and by modernizing its district heating network. The Ukraine Energy Outlook will provide guidance on how Ukraine can achieve its climate goals of carbon neutrality by 2050 and phase out of coal by 2040.
The Danish Energy Agency is implementing partner and will continue its close partnership with the Ministry of Energy of Ukraine (developed during the previous phase) and start cooperation with a new partner, the Ministry for Communities and Territories Development, within the area of district heating. This follows a great Ukrainian interest in the Danish district heating system.
Energy experts from the Danish Energy Agency will contribute with advice, technical assistance and peer-to-peer learning in several areas. This includes energy efficiency in industry, strategic energy planning and long-term modelling of scenarios that can show pathways to a green transformation of Ukraine's energy system with focus on renewable energy and energy efficiency.
The collaboration will focus on strengthening the environment for sustainable energy solutions and technologies based on Danish expertise and technical assistance, as well as opening up opportunities for companies working with green energy.
The overall goal of the support is: “Ukraine realizes its Nationally Determined Contribution (NDC) goals and achieves SDG7 and SDG13 targets”.
The intended impact is: “Reduced greenhouse gas emissions and improved security of supply, though improved system planning, market development and increased sustainable energy and district heating modernization”.
The objective is that: “The enabling environment for investment in sustainable energy and district heating is strengthened, assisting Ukraine in achieving its energy efficiency, renewable energy, and energy independence targets and modernising district heating”.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Scenario-based long-term energy modelling and planning informs sustainable energy policy and strategy.

description.narrative: A modelling framework for energy system planning is implemented in Ukraine that is comparable to international best practice, and informed by current Danish approaches in terms of scope and technical detail. A Ukraine Energy Outlook and Technology Catalogues are integrated in policy development and decision making, and updated and published on regular (biennial) basis.

title.narrative: Scenario-based long-term energy modelling and planning informs sustainable energy policy and strategy.

description.narrative: A modelling framework for energy system planning is implemented in Ukraine that is comparable to international best practice, and informed by current Danish approaches in terms of scope and technical detail. A Ukraine Energy Outlook and Technology Catalogues are integrated in policy development and decision making, and updated and published on regular (biennial) basis.

comment.narrative:
The Ukraine Energy Outlook concept is under development and the publication of the first Ukraine Energy Outlook is planned.
The incorporation of model- or scenario-based approaches is limited.
Power generation technology catalogues are not available in Ukraine.

title.narrative: Technology catalogue and technical guidelines for energy efficiency and fuel substitution in industry.

description.narrative: Companies have access and apply the developed technology catalogue and technical guidelines to determine and evaluate energy savings. Findings from technology catalogue, technical guidelines and fuel substitution are integrated into working procedures of the State Agency for Energy Efficiency and Energy Saving of Ukraine (SAEE) and other stakeholders.

title.narrative: Technology catalogue and technical guidelines for energy efficiency and fuel substitution in industry.

description.narrative: Companies have access and apply the developed technology catalogue and technical guidelines to determine and evaluate energy savings. Findings from technology catalogue, technical guidelines and fuel substitution are integrated into working procedures of the State Agency for Energy Efficiency and Energy Saving of Ukraine (SAEE) and other stakeholders.

comment.narrative: Information about the benefits and possibilities of energy efficiency and energy management is not adequately disseminated. Limited knowledge about energy savings and greenhouse gas (GHG) abatement potentials in the industry.

title.narrative: Incentive schemes and technology guidelines support the uptake of energy efficiency improvements in industry, heat and power generation.

description.narrative: Enhanced and operational national support mechanism for energy efficiency in industry is adopted and further secondary legislation is formulated to support energy efficiency and highly efficient cogeneration, leading to increased investments in energy efficiency in industry.

title.narrative: Incentive schemes and technology guidelines support the uptake of energy efficiency improvements in industry, heat and power generation.

description.narrative: Enhanced and operational national support mechanism for energy efficiency in industry is adopted and further secondary legislation is formulated to support energy efficiency and highly efficient cogeneration, leading to increased investments in energy efficiency in industry.

comment.narrative: There is no incentive scheme for state support for stimulating energy efficiency in industry and using highly efficient cogeneration. There is limited knowledge about opportunities and courses of action with respect to energy efficiency and excess heat utilisation in industry and power plants.

title.narrative: Through the improvement of the national regulation, holistic planning capacity and framework conditions for investments, the modernization of district heating in Ukraine is supported.

description.narrative: Measures are being taken at institutional level by the Ministry for Communities and Territories Development (MinRegion) to improve the framework conditions for district heating systems in Ukraine leading to modernization of district heating (DH) systems in pilot projects. The DH regulation is further developed through the adoption of new guidelines, with inspiration from Danish experiences.

title.narrative: Through the improvement of the national regulation, holistic planning capacity and framework conditions for investments, the modernization of district heating in Ukraine is supported.

description.narrative: Measures are being taken at institutional level by the Ministry for Communities and Territories Development (MinRegion) to improve the framework conditions for district heating systems in Ukraine leading to modernization of district heating (DH) systems in pilot projects. The DH regulation is further developed through the adoption of new guidelines, with inspiration from Danish experiences.

comment.narrative: District heating systems in Ukraine are generally facing several challenges. The ones in the worst conditions are facing closure, while there are some functioning but still in need for modernisation. The Ukrainian district heating sector has a lot of competence and skills, which are a solid foundation for development.

title.narrative: Capacity developed in district heating planning and modernization at national level to realise the benefits of sector coupling and energy system efficiency.

description.narrative:
MinRegion has modernised the district heating regulation and guidelines with focus on sector coupling and energy system efficiency.
Stakeholders have become aware of the benefits of district heating for the energy system and the opportunities for sector coupling, through capacity development workshops and quantitative analyses.

title.narrative: Capacity developed in district heating planning and modernization at national level to realise the benefits of sector coupling and energy system efficiency.

description.narrative:
MinRegion has modernised the district heating regulation and guidelines with focus on sector coupling and energy system efficiency.
Stakeholders have become aware of the benefits of district heating for the energy system and the opportunities for sector coupling, through capacity development workshops and quantitative analyses.

comment.narrative: The current situation of district heating (DH) systems in Ukraine is critical, with the national regulation requiring to be updated and improved. The knowledge, competences and skills in the Ukrainian district heating sector are present.

title.narrative: Scenario-based long-term modelling of the Ukrainian energy system, presented in biennial Energy Outlook Reports to support national energy planning and policy development.

description.narrative:
Ukraine Energy Outlook is integrated in policy development and decision making, and reports progress with respect to energy and climate goals.
The Outlook includes a least-cost assessment for energy system development, and presents analysis of various policies and measures proposed and/or implemented by the MOE.
The Outlook is updated and published on a regular (biennial) basis, and MOE has sufficient capacity to conduct analyses without requiring support from DEA, or other international actors.

title.narrative: Scenario-based long-term modelling of the Ukrainian energy system, presented in biennial Energy Outlook Reports to support national energy planning and policy development.

description.narrative:
Ukraine Energy Outlook is integrated in policy development and decision making, and reports progress with respect to energy and climate goals.
The Outlook includes a least-cost assessment for energy system development, and presents analysis of various policies and measures proposed and/or implemented by the MOE.
The Outlook is updated and published on a regular (biennial) basis, and MOE has sufficient capacity to conduct analyses without requiring support from DEA, or other international actors.

comment.narrative:
Publication of first Ukraine Energy Outlook is planned. The Outlook is reviewed by Ukrainian energy sector stakeholders and their feedback is incorporated.
Several strategic documents and plans pertaining to the energy sector are under development.
